<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-c">#Install Packages</span>
<span class="pl-v">pkg</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>ggplot2<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>tm<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>SnowballC<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>stringi<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>stringr<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>openNLP<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>NLP<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>qdap<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>dplyr<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>foreach<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-v">new.pkg</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">pkg</span>[<span class="pl-k">!</span>(<span class="pl-smi">pkg</span> <span class="pl-k">%in%</span> installed.packages()[,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Package<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>])]
<span class="pl-k">if</span> (length(<span class="pl-smi">new.pkg</span>)) {install.packages(<span class="pl-smi">new.pkg</span>,<span class="pl-v">dependencies</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)}
sapply(<span class="pl-smi">pkg</span>,<span class="pl-smi">require</span>,<span class="pl-v">character.only</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">import_text_documents</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-v">directory</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">doc_dirs</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">no_type</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>), <span class="pl-v">file_pattern</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\\</span>.tsv$<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) {

  <span class="pl-v">file_names</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> list.files(<span class="pl-v">path</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">directory</span>, <span class="pl-v">pattern</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>*<span class="pl-cce">\\</span>.tsv<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">full.names</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">F</span>, <span class="pl-v">recursive</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">T</span>)
  cat(paste0(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Found <span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, length(<span class="pl-smi">file_names</span>), <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span> text files in <span class="pl-cce">\"</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">directory</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\"</span> to import.<span class="pl-cce">\n</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))

  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (length(<span class="pl-smi">file_names</span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>) {
    stop(paste(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>did not find any files to load. <span class="pl-cce">\n</span>Make sure you have unzipped the training<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,
               <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>data into the inbound directory.<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))
  }

  <span class="pl-c"># This takes a while to run</span>
  system.time({
    <span class="pl-c"># Recursively load all text files in subdirectories of our main file directory.</span>
    <span class="pl-v">docs</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()
    <span class="pl-c"># Since disk is the main bottleneck here, multicore processing probably wouldn't help.</span>
    <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">type</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> names(<span class="pl-smi">doc_dirs</span>)) {
      <span class="pl-smi">docs</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">type</span>]] <span class="pl-k">=</span> Corpus(DirSource(paste0(<span class="pl-smi">directory</span>, <span class="pl-smi">doc_dirs</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">type</span>]]), <span class="pl-v">pattern</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">file_pattern</span>))
      cat(paste0(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Processed <span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">type</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span> in subdir <span class="pl-cce">\"</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">doc_dirs</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">type</span>]], <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\"</span> and found <span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, length(<span class="pl-smi">docs</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">type</span>]]), <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span> documents.<span class="pl-cce">\n</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))
    }
  })

  cat(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Total documents loaded:<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, sum(sapply(<span class="pl-smi">docs</span>, <span class="pl-smi">length</span>)), <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\n</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)

  <span class="pl-c"># Return the result.</span>
  <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-smi">docs</span>)
}
<span class="pl-smi">docs</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> 
  import_text_documents(getwd())</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-c">### Exclude the common word features (known as stop words) listed in</span>
<span class="pl-c"># http://www.textfixer.com/resources/common-english-words.txt</span>
<span class="pl-c"># For step 1.</span>
<span class="pl-v">load_stopwords</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-v">input_file</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> file.choose(), <span class="pl-v">output_file</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>stopwords.Rda<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-v">reload_file</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">F</span>) {
  <span class="pl-c"># Just re-use the output file if it already exists.</span>
  <span class="pl-c"># Set reload_file = T if you want to force the function to reload the input file.</span>
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (<span class="pl-k">!</span><span class="pl-smi">reload_file</span> <span class="pl-k">&amp;&amp;</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">output_file</span>) <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span> <span class="pl-k">&amp;&amp;</span> file.exists(<span class="pl-smi">output_file</span>)) {
    load(<span class="pl-smi">output_file</span>)
  } <span class="pl-k">else</span> {
    <span class="pl-c"># Load the official stopword list and make sure it's the same as the one used by tm.</span>
    <span class="pl-v">file_con</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> file(<span class="pl-smi">input_file</span>)
    <span class="pl-c"># Process it as one line separated by commas, and convert it to a vector.</span>
    <span class="pl-v">stopwords</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> unlist(strsplit(readLines(<span class="pl-smi">file_con</span>)[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>], <span class="pl-v">split</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>,<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>), <span class="pl-v">fixed</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">T</span>))
    close(<span class="pl-smi">file_con</span>)

    <span class="pl-k">if</span> (length(<span class="pl-smi">output_file</span>) <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>) {
      save(<span class="pl-smi">stopwords</span>, <span class="pl-v">file</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">output_file</span>)
    }
  }
  <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-smi">stopwords</span>)
}
load(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>stopwords.Rda<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"># Derive a dictionary of words/ bigrams and total number of their appearances through out the whole dataset.</span>
<span class="pl-v">clean_documents</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span>, <span class="pl-v">stopwords</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">stopwords</span>) {
  <span class="pl-v">hrc</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span>, content_transformer(<span class="pl-smi">tolower</span>))

  <span class="pl-c"># hrc = tm_map(hrc, removeWords)</span>
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (length(<span class="pl-smi">stopwords</span>) <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>) {
    <span class="pl-v">hrc</span>  <span class="pl-k">=</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span>, <span class="pl-smi">removeWords</span>, <span class="pl-smi">stopwords</span>)
  }


  <span class="pl-c"># NOTE: we should double-check this removePunctuation code, because it may remove the punctation</span>
  <span class="pl-c"># without substituting spaces, which will mess up the words.</span>
  <span class="pl-v">dtm</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> DocumentTermMatrix(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span>,
                           <span class="pl-v">control</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">tolower</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">T</span>, <span class="pl-v">stopwords</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">T</span>, <span class="pl-v">removePunctuation</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">T</span>, <span class="pl-v">removeNumbers</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">T</span>, <span class="pl-v">stemming</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">T</span>)
  )
  <span class="pl-v">dtm</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> removeSparseTerms(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>, .<span class="pl-c1">99</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">dtm</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.data.frame(as.matrix(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>))
  <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>)
}
<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> read.table(file.choose(), <span class="pl-v">stringsAsFactors</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>)
<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span><span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span>clean_documents(Corpus(VectorSource(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">V2</span>)), <span class="pl-smi">stopwords</span>)</pre></div>

<h3><a id="user-content-lets-get-rid-of-this-segment" class="anchor" href="#lets-get-rid-of-this-segment" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Lets get rid of this segment</h3>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"># For step 2; docs is a list of matrices loaded in step 1.</span>
<span class="pl-v">clean_imported_documents</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-v">docs</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">docs</span>, <span class="pl-v">stopwords</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">stopwords</span>) {

  <span class="pl-v">cleaned_docs</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>()

  <span class="pl-c"># This step is slow. </span>
  <span class="pl-c">#foreach (type in names(docs)) %dopar% {</span>
  system.time({
    <span class="pl-v">cleaned_docs</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> foreach (<span class="pl-v">type</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> names(<span class="pl-smi">docs</span>)) %<span class="pl-smi">dopar</span>% {
    <span class="pl-c">#if (type != "no_type") {</span>
    <span class="pl-c">#  cat("Cleaning", type, "\n")</span>
    <span class="pl-c">#}</span>
    <span class="pl-c">#cleaned_docs[[type]] = clean_documents(docs[[type]], stopwords)</span>
      <span class="pl-v">doc_set</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> clean_documents(<span class="pl-smi">docs</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">type</span>]], <span class="pl-smi">stopwords</span>)

      <span class="pl-c"># Fix rownames - remove the .txt suffix from the name.</span>
      rownames(<span class="pl-smi">doc_set</span>) <span class="pl-k">=</span> gsub(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\\</span>.txt$<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, rownames(<span class="pl-smi">doc_set</span>))

      <span class="pl-c"># Prepend the document class to reduce chance of duplicate rownames.</span>
      <span class="pl-c"># But don't do this if we have only a single document class (e.g. no_class).</span>
      <span class="pl-k">if</span> (length(<span class="pl-smi">docs</span>) <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span>) {
        rownames(<span class="pl-smi">doc_set</span>) <span class="pl-k">=</span> paste0(<span class="pl-smi">type</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>_<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, rownames(<span class="pl-smi">doc_set</span>))
      }

      <span class="pl-smi">doc_set</span>
    }
  })
  names(<span class="pl-smi">cleaned_docs</span>) <span class="pl-k">=</span> names(<span class="pl-smi">docs</span>)
  <span class="pl-c"># Confirm document dimensions:</span>
  sapply(<span class="pl-smi">cleaned_docs</span>, <span class="pl-v">FUN</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">dim</span>)

  <span class="pl-c"># This creates our target/response vector as a factor with values of e-mail senders</span>
  <span class="pl-v">targets</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">NA</span>
  <span class="pl-c"># This will run if we have outcome labels for the data, otherwise we'll keep targets as NA.</span>
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (length(names(<span class="pl-smi">docs</span>)) <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span> <span class="pl-k">|</span> names(<span class="pl-smi">docs</span>)[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>] <span class="pl-k">!=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>no_type<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) {
    <span class="pl-v">targets</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.factor(unlist(sapply(names(<span class="pl-smi">cleaned_docs</span>), <span class="pl-v">simplify</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>array<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">USE.NAMES</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">F</span>,
                        <span class="pl-v">FUN</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">doc_type</span>){ rep(<span class="pl-smi">doc_type</span>, <span class="pl-v">length.out</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>nrow(as.matrix(<span class="pl-smi">cleaned_docs</span>[[<span class="pl-smi">doc_type</span>]])))})))
  } 

  <span class="pl-c"># Combine docs into a single dataframe - takes roughly a minute on EC2.</span>
  system.time({
    <span class="pl-v">docs</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.data.frame(as.matrix(do.call(<span class="pl-e">tm</span><span class="pl-k">:::</span><span class="pl-smi">c.DocumentTermMatrix</span>, <span class="pl-smi">cleaned_docs</span>)))
  })


  <span class="pl-c"># Confirm that we have no duplicated rownames.</span>
  length(unique(rownames(<span class="pl-smi">docs</span>))) <span class="pl-k">==</span> nrow(<span class="pl-smi">docs</span>)

  <span class="pl-c"># Make sure that the # of rows in the document corpus equals the length of our target vector.</span>
  <span class="pl-c"># Otherwise stop and give an error.</span>
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (length(<span class="pl-smi">targets</span>) <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span> <span class="pl-k">||</span> <span class="pl-k">!</span>is.na(<span class="pl-smi">targets</span>)) {
    stopifnot(nrow(<span class="pl-smi">docs</span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">targets</span>))
  }

  <span class="pl-c"># Return our result.</span>
  <span class="pl-v">result</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">docs</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">docs</span>, <span class="pl-v">targets</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">targets</span>)
  <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-smi">result</span>)
}</pre></div>

<h3><a id="user-content-lets-get-rid-of-this-segment-1" class="anchor" href="#lets-get-rid-of-this-segment-1" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Lets get rid of this segment</h3>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">convert_text_to_sentences</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">text</span>, <span class="pl-v">lang</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>en<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) {
  <span class="pl-c"># Check if the string is only whitespace</span>
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (<span class="pl-smi">text</span> <span class="pl-k">%in%</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span> <span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">||</span> str_count(<span class="pl-smi">text</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\\</span>s<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">==</span> str_length(<span class="pl-smi">text</span>)) {
    <span class="pl-k">return</span>(c())
  }
  <span class="pl-v">sentence_token_annotator</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> Maxent_Sent_Token_Annotator(<span class="pl-v">language</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">lang</span>)
  <span class="pl-smi">text</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> as.String(<span class="pl-smi">text</span>)
  <span class="pl-c"># Need to specify NLP package, because ggplot2 also has an annotate function.</span>
  <span class="pl-v">sentence.boundaries</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-e">NLP</span><span class="pl-k">::</span>annotate(<span class="pl-smi">text</span>, <span class="pl-smi">sentence_token_annotator</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">sentences</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">text</span>[<span class="pl-smi">sentence.boundaries</span>]
  <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-smi">sentences</span>)
}

<span class="pl-c">### external function(2): removes punctuations</span>
<span class="pl-v">remove_punc</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) {
  gsub(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>[[:punct:]]<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">x</span>)
}

<span class="pl-c">### main function: generates sentence-based power feature matrix</span>
<span class="pl-c">### input: tm data</span>
<span class="pl-c">### output: 4 columns of power features with rownames=filename</span></pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-c"># For step 1.</span>
<span class="pl-smi">doc_6</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> Corpus(VectorSource(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">V2</span>))
<span class="pl-v">power_features_sentence</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-v">doc</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">doc_6</span>) {
  <span class="pl-v">n</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">doc</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">power</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(<span class="pl-c1">NA</span>, <span class="pl-v">nrow</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">n</span>, <span class="pl-v">ncol</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">6</span>, <span class="pl-v">dimnames</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(seq(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>, <span class="pl-smi">n</span>)))

  <span class="pl-c"># Run this processing outside of the loop to make it faster.</span>
  <span class="pl-v">hrcs</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">doc</span>, content_transformer(<span class="pl-smi">tolower</span>))

  <span class="pl-v">hrcs</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">hrcs</span>, <span class="pl-smi">stripWhitespace</span>)
  <span class="pl-c"># Stemming takes a particularly long time.</span>
  <span class="pl-v">hrcs</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">hrcs</span>, <span class="pl-smi">stemDocument</span>) 

  <span class="pl-c"># TODO: figure out how to remove this For loop to improve speed. </span>
  <span class="pl-k">for</span> (<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-smi">n</span>) {

    <span class="pl-v">hrc</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">hrcs</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>]

    <span class="pl-v">text</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.data.frame(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span>)[<span class="pl-c1">2</span>]
    <span class="pl-v">sents</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> convert_text_to_sentences(<span class="pl-smi">text</span>)

    <span class="pl-c"># CK: Can we convert this to tm_map(sents, removePunctation)?</span>
    <span class="pl-v">sents2</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> lapply(<span class="pl-smi">sents</span>, <span class="pl-smi">remove_punc</span>)

    <span class="pl-c"># Number of sentences.</span>
    <span class="pl-v">power6</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(<span class="pl-smi">sents2</span>)

    <span class="pl-c"># Average sentence length.</span>
    <span class="pl-c"># TODO: convert to directly calculate average strength length without regex.</span>
    <span class="pl-v">power7</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sum(stri_count(<span class="pl-smi">sents2</span>, <span class="pl-v">regex</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\\</span>S+<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)) <span class="pl-k">/</span> max(<span class="pl-c1">1</span>, length(<span class="pl-smi">sents2</span>))

    <span class="pl-c"># Number of 4-digit numbers (years). </span>
    <span class="pl-v">power8</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(na.omit(str_extract(<span class="pl-smi">sents2</span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\\</span>d{4}<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)))

    <span class="pl-c"># Number of digits.</span>
    <span class="pl-c"># CK: actually, this is number of sentences that contain a digit.</span>
    <span class="pl-v">power9</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sum(grepl(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>[[:digit:]]<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">sents2</span>))

    <span class="pl-c"># Number of question marks.</span>
    <span class="pl-v">power10</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sum(str_count(<span class="pl-smi">text</span>, fixed(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>?<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)))

    <span class="pl-c">#s Number of exclamation marks.</span>
    <span class="pl-v">power11</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sum(str_count(<span class="pl-smi">text</span>, fixed(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>!<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)))

    <span class="pl-c">### </span>

    <span class="pl-c">#title = names(hrc)</span>
    <span class="pl-c">#power[i,] = as.matrix(cbind(power6, power7, power8, power9))</span>
    <span class="pl-smi">power</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>, ] <span class="pl-k">=</span> c(<span class="pl-smi">power6</span>, <span class="pl-smi">power7</span>, <span class="pl-smi">power8</span>, <span class="pl-smi">power9</span>, <span class="pl-smi">power10</span>, <span class="pl-smi">power11</span>)
    <span class="pl-c">#rownames(power)[i] = title</span>
  }
  rownames(<span class="pl-smi">power</span>) <span class="pl-k">=</span> names(<span class="pl-smi">hrcs</span>)
  colnames(<span class="pl-smi">power</span>) <span class="pl-k">=</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>sentence_count<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>sentence_avg_length<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>4digit_nums<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>digit_count<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>question_marks<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>exclamation_points<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
  <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-smi">power</span>)
}</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-c">### input: dtm</span>
<span class="pl-c">### output: new power features matrix</span>
<span class="pl-v">power_features_dtm</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>) {

  <span class="pl-v">new</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">matrix</span>(<span class="pl-c1">NA</span>,<span class="pl-v">nrow</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>),<span class="pl-v">ncol</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">6</span>)
  colnames(<span class="pl-smi">new</span>) <span class="pl-k">=</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>words_count<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>chars_count<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>words_avg_length<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>words_distinct<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>sd_words<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>word_diversity<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
  <span class="pl-v">words_chars</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> nchar(colnames(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>))

  <span class="pl-k">for</span>(<span class="pl-smi">i</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span>nrow(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>)){
    <span class="pl-c">### power1: total number of words</span>
    <span class="pl-smi">new</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> sum(as.numeric(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,]))

    <span class="pl-c">### power2: total number of characters</span>
    <span class="pl-smi">new</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.numeric(t(as.matrix(<span class="pl-smi">words_chars</span>))<span class="pl-k">%*%</span>as.matrix(as.numeric(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,])))

    <span class="pl-c">### power3: returns the vector of average word length of each txt file</span>
    <span class="pl-c"># Use max so that if there are 0 distinct words we don't try to divide by 0.</span>
    <span class="pl-smi">new</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">3</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">new</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">2</span>]<span class="pl-k">/</span>max(<span class="pl-smi">new</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>], <span class="pl-c1">1</span>)

    <span class="pl-c">### power4: number of unique words</span>
    <span class="pl-smi">new</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">4</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> length(which(as.numeric(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,])<span class="pl-k">!=</span><span class="pl-c1">0</span>))

    <span class="pl-c">### power5: standard deviation of word length</span>
    <span class="pl-c"># CK: why not just use the sd() function here?</span>
    <span class="pl-v">sqrdmean</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sum(as.matrix(<span class="pl-smi">words_chars</span><span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>) <span class="pl-k">*</span> as.matrix(as.numeric(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,])))<span class="pl-k">/</span>max(<span class="pl-smi">new</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>], <span class="pl-c1">1</span>)
    <span class="pl-v">mean</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> sum(<span class="pl-smi">words_chars</span><span class="pl-k">*</span>as.matrix(as.numeric(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,])))<span class="pl-k">/</span>max(<span class="pl-smi">new</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>], <span class="pl-c1">1</span>)
    <span class="pl-smi">new</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">5</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">sqrdmean</span><span class="pl-k">-</span>(<span class="pl-smi">mean</span><span class="pl-k">^</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>)

    <span class="pl-c">### power6: word diversity</span>
    <span class="pl-smi">new</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">6</span>] <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">new</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">4</span>]<span class="pl-k">/</span>max(<span class="pl-smi">new</span>[<span class="pl-smi">i</span>,<span class="pl-c1">1</span>], <span class="pl-c1">1</span>)

  }
  <span class="pl-v">new</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.data.frame(<span class="pl-smi">new</span>)
  <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-smi">new</span>)
}</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-c">################ power features bigrams: most frequent 2950 features ###############</span>
<span class="pl-c">### input: tm data</span>
<span class="pl-c">### output: power feature columns</span>
library(<span class="pl-smi">NLP</span>)

<span class="pl-c"># Change ngrams to 3 when calling to get trigrams.</span>
<span class="pl-v">NgramTokenizer</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>, <span class="pl-v">ngram</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">2</span>) {
  <span class="pl-c"># Specify NLP package because qdap also provides the ngrams function.</span>
  unlist(lapply(<span class="pl-e">NLP</span><span class="pl-k">::</span>ngrams(words(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>), <span class="pl-smi">ngram</span>), <span class="pl-smi">paste</span>, <span class="pl-v">collapse</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span> <span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>), <span class="pl-v">use.names</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>)
}

<span class="pl-v">BigramTokenizer</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>, <span class="pl-v">ngram</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">2</span>) {
  NgramTokenizer(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>, <span class="pl-smi">ngram</span>)
}

<span class="pl-c"># Separate function because it's unclear how to change a parameter in the DocumentTermMatrix call.</span>
<span class="pl-v">TrigramTokenizer</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>, <span class="pl-v">ngram</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">3</span>) {
  NgramTokenizer(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>, <span class="pl-smi">ngram</span>)
}


<span class="pl-c"># Specify core to prevent a bug when multiple cores are used.</span>
options(<span class="pl-v">mc.cores</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>)

<span class="pl-v">hrc_8</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> Corpus(VectorSource(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">V2</span>))

<span class="pl-v">power_features_ngrams</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span>, <span class="pl-v">stopwordss</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">stopwords</span>, <span class="pl-v">ngram</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-v">min_sparsity</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">0.99</span>) {
  <span class="pl-v">hrc</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span>, content_transformer(<span class="pl-smi">tolower</span>))
  <span class="pl-v">hrc</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span>, <span class="pl-smi">removePunctuation</span>)
  <span class="pl-v">hrc</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span>, <span class="pl-smi">removeNumbers</span>)

  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (length(<span class="pl-smi">stopwords</span>) <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>) {
    <span class="pl-v">hrc</span>  <span class="pl-k">=</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span>, <span class="pl-smi">removeWords</span>, <span class="pl-smi">stopwordss</span>)
  }
  <span class="pl-v">hrc</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> tm_map(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span>, <span class="pl-smi">stripWhitespace</span>)

  <span class="pl-c"># Generate all ngrams as features.</span>

  <span class="pl-c"># Choose which function to pass because it's unclear how we would change an argument.</span>
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (<span class="pl-smi">ngram</span> <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-c1">3</span>) {
    <span class="pl-v">f</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">TrigramTokenizer</span>
  } <span class="pl-k">else</span> {
    <span class="pl-v">f</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">BigramTokenizer</span>
  }

  <span class="pl-v">dtm_ngrams</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> DocumentTermMatrix(<span class="pl-smi">hrc</span>,
                           <span class="pl-v">control</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">tokenize</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">f</span>, <span class="pl-v">stopwordss</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">T</span>, <span class="pl-v">stemming</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">T</span>))

  <span class="pl-c"># We have to removeSparseTerm before converting to a matrix because there may be too many cells otherwise (&gt; a billion).</span>
  <span class="pl-c"># This is a loose restriction - bigram must be used in at least 1% of documents.</span>
  <span class="pl-c"># TODO: may need to tweak this for prediction/verification data - don't want to remove training bigrams.</span>
  <span class="pl-v">dtm_nosparse</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> removeSparseTerms(<span class="pl-smi">dtm_ngrams</span>, <span class="pl-smi">min_sparsity</span>)

  <span class="pl-c"># Confirm that we did not remove every bigram.</span>
  stopifnot(<span class="pl-smi">dtm_nosparse</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">ncol</span> <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>)

  <span class="pl-v">dtm</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> as.data.frame(as.matrix(<span class="pl-smi">dtm_nosparse</span>))

  <span class="pl-c"># Identify how many docs use each n-gram.</span>
  <span class="pl-v">usage</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> apply(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>, <span class="pl-v">MARGIN</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-v">FUN</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>){ sum(<span class="pl-k">!</span>is.na(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>) <span class="pl-k">&amp;</span> <span class="pl-smi">x</span> <span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">0</span>) })

  <span class="pl-c"># Look at the top 50 bigrams</span>
  sort(<span class="pl-smi">usage</span>, <span class="pl-v">decreasing</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">T</span>)[<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-k">:</span><span class="pl-c1">50</span>]

  <span class="pl-c"># Exclude bigrams that are used in every document.</span>
  <span class="pl-c"># filtered = bigrams_usage[bigrams_usage != nrow(dtm)]</span>
  <span class="pl-c"># filtered = bigrams_usage</span>

  <span class="pl-c"># Choose the top X bigrams based on how many docs they are used in.</span>
  <span class="pl-c">#sorted = sort(filtered, decreasing=T)[1:2950]</span>
  <span class="pl-c">#bigrams_freq = names(sorted)</span>
  <span class="pl-c">#dtm = dtm[, bigrams_freq]</span>

  <span class="pl-k">return</span>(<span class="pl-smi">dtm</span>)
}</pre></div>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-c">########################## Power features matrix ##########################</span>

<span class="pl-c">######################### Word+Power features matrix ########################</span>

<span class="pl-c"># Setup multicore processing to speed up the model training.</span>
<span class="pl-v">setup_multicore</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-v">conf</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">NULL</span>) {
  cat(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Cores detected:<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, detectCores(), <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\n</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (exists(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>conf<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">&amp;&amp;</span> <span class="pl-k">!</span>is.null(<span class="pl-smi">conf</span>)) {
    registerDoMC(<span class="pl-smi">conf</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">num_cores</span>)
  } <span class="pl-k">else</span> {
    <span class="pl-c"># Uses half of the available cores by default, which is a good default setting.</span>
    registerDoMC()
  }
  cat(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Workers enabled:<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, getDoParWorkers(), <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span><span class="pl-cce">\n</span><span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
}
</pre></div>
